intro: Viola humilis, commonly known as the common violet, is a low-growing herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and features heart-shaped, velvety leaves with a deep green color. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of purple, violet, or white, usually blooming from late spring to early summer. Viola humilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
